sentences.en: He went abroad with his parents'benediction.
sentences.cn: 他带着父母的祝福出国去了.

sentences.en: I shall feel the benediction of the good God when Cosette is here.
sentences.cn: 珂赛特到了此地时,我就会感到上帝的保佑.

sentences.en: Mr. Wolfshiem raised his hand in a sort of benediction.
sentences.cn: 沃尔大山姆光生像祝福似地举起了手.

sentences.en: Refreshment was served after the benediction.
sentences.cn: 牧师祝福后,有茶点招待弟兄姐妹.

sentences.en: Sending you a bunch of benediction, and blessing you from bottom of my heart.
sentences.cn: 送去一束祝福, 以最诚挚的心对你切切祝愿.

sentences.en: Such songs have power to quiet the restless pulse of andthe benediction that follows after prayer.
sentences.cn: 这样的诗歌具有安神的力量能将焦虑的心灵抚慰,正如祈祷之后的祝福,让人变得从容宁静.

sentences.en: Suddenly Stella felt the most amazing sensation of peace and benediction wash over her.
sentences.cn: 突然间,斯特拉觉得自己沉浸在一片平静和享受祝福的奇妙感情中,就像被裹在充满爱意的怀抱之中.

sentences.en: The Pope's hands were raised in benediction.
The priest pronounced a benediction over the couple at the end of the marriage ceremony.
sentences.cn: 牧师在婚礼结束时为新婚夫妇祈求上帝赐福.

sentences.en: The song hovered, like a whispered benediction, above the crowd.
sentences.cn: 歌声缭绕在人群上方，如同低声祝福。

sentences.en: The touch of the sun felt like a benediction.
sentences.cn: 沐浴在这阳光下,如同沐浴在祝福中.

trans.tran_cn: 祝福，（礼拜结束时的）赐福祈祷，恩赐，（大写）（罗马天主教）祈求上帝赐福的仪式
trans.tran_en: a Christian prayer that asks God to protect and help someone
